intro: Pedicularis yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange, often resembling those of other species in the genus. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in moist, shaded conditions. Pedicularis yunnanensis is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its ecological role in its native habitat.
